roots.meaning: to teach
roots.theoretical_semantics: The Ge'ez root m-m-h is historically tied to the general Afro-Semitic meaning: to teach.

roots.meaning: to hope
roots.theoretical_semantics: The Ge'ez root t-s-f is historically tied to the general Afro-Semitic meaning: to hope.

roots.meaning: to measure
roots.theoretical_semantics: The Ge'ez root ʾ-m-s is historically tied to the general Afro-Semitic meaning: to measure.

roots.meaning: to choose
roots.theoretical_semantics: The Ge'ez root f-l-g is historically tied to the general Afro-Semitic meaning: to choose.

roots.meaning: to worship
roots.theoretical_semantics: The Ge'ez root s-g-d is historically tied to the general Afro-Semitic meaning: to worship.

roots.meaning: to honor
roots.theoretical_semantics: The Ge'ez root k-b-r is historically tied to the general Afro-Semitic meaning: to honor.

roots.meaning: to learn / to discipline
roots.theoretical_semantics: The Ge'ez root ʿ-m-t is historically tied to the general Afro-Semitic meaning: to learn / to discipline.

roots.meaning: A constructed teaching root demonstrating the s,k,m pattern.
roots.theoretical_semantics: This hypothetical Ge'ez root s-k-m reflects tri-consonantal structure and helps learners recognize Semitic meaning formation.
